titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that May 22, 1987, be observed by the people of the United States as a day to commemorate the Truman Doctrine and to honor the shared achievements and common commitment to democracy of the Greek, Turkish, and American peoples.

bill.summary: 3/17/1987--Introduced. Calls for observing May 22, 1987, the 40th anniversary of the Truman Doctrine, as Truman Doctrine Commemoration Day by honoring the achievements of the Greek, Turkish, and American peoples and reaffirming their commitment to democracy.
